intro: Sedum cogmansense, commonly known as the rock sedum, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its leaves are typically blue-green in color and have a slightly waxy texture. Sedum cogmansense is known for its hardiness and ability to survive in arid conditions with minimal water.
